Articles.Content:
I'm having a few issues creating flag decals. I've done this in the past, but the exact knowledge has leaked out of my ears sometime between then and the present.

In-Game: (Note, "toggle flag" does nothing)

In-Unity:

In-Material:

In-Config: 

MODULE
{
      name = FlagDecal
      textureQuadName = FlagTexture
}

 

Edited April 18, 2016 by Beale

an earlier module in the config may be broken, that would cause subsequent modules to break. typically FlagDecal module is placed last in the config. Is this the only module on the part?

To be on the safe side, I assign the main part texture to the flag decal transform to avoid missing texture link issues when exporting or loading.

Edited April 18, 2016 by nli2work

19 minutes ago, nli2work said:

an earlier module in the config may be broken, that would cause subsequent modules to break. typically FlagDecal module is placed last in the config. Is this the only module on the part?

To be on the safe side, I assign the main part texture to the flag decal transform to avoid missing texture link issues when exporting or loading.

Thanks for the info, for sure a module error.
I switched the position of the flagDecal to #1 and all works fine.

The problem now is to hunt down the faulty module! 
I can keep changing the position of the FlagDecal one step at a time to find the culprit I guess.

Edit: Animation null reference! Fixed  

Edited April 18, 2016 by Beale

Glad you at least narrowed down the problem!

 

One little tip I want to share: Uncheck "cast shadows" on flag meshes. Depending on the scale, separation distance from the surface underneath, and angle of light, it's possible for the flag to cast some shadow onto the surface that it's supposedly painted on, which can look really wrong. So I make it a point to not allow it to case shadows, ever.

 

Second tip: Set a tag on it to "Icon_Hidden" so that it doesn't show up in the VAB menu icons with the part's texture (or a white rectangle or whatever).

 

2 hours ago, nli2work said:

To be on the safe side, I assign the main part texture to the flag decal transform to avoid missing texture link issues when exporting or loading.

 

I agree with this. I've had inconsistent results in the past, but I've seen cases where something doesn't get instantiated if there isn't an existing initial texture. This is a problem more with texture reassignment in the "MODEL { }" section of the CFG, for sure, but to be safe I'd assign the main texture here too.

9 hours ago, NecroBones said:

 

Glad you at least narrowed down the problem!
One little tip I want to share: Uncheck "cast shadows" on flag meshes. Depending on the scale, separation distance from the surface underneath, and angle of light, it's possible for the flag to cast some shadow onto the surface that it's supposedly painted on, which can look really wrong. So I make it a point to not allow it to case shadows, ever.
Second tip: Set a tag on it to "Icon_Hidden" so that it doesn't show up in the VAB menu icons with the part's texture (or a white rectangle or whatever).
I agree with this. I've had inconsistent results in the past, but I've seen cases where something doesn't get instantiated if there isn't an existing initial texture. This is a problem more with texture reassignment in the "MODEL { }" section of the CFG, for sure, but to be safe I'd assign the main texture here too.

Great tips all around, many thanks NecroBones!

Edited April 19, 2016 by Beale
